p: The dysregulated immune system of the elderly is related to the increased activity of myeloid-derived suppressor cells (MDSC) [ 117, 118]. MDSCs are potent inducers of immunosenescence [ 119], sepsis-acquired immunodeficiency [ 120] as well as cancer metastasis and progression [ 121]. MDSC are positively correlated with IL-6 and negatively correlated with IFN-Ï’ [ 122, 123].
